result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Thomas D. Kroken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: the defendant shall obtain a high school diploma, HSED or it's equivalent
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Upon successful completion of probation, the record shall be expunged pursuant to 973.015, i.e. no holds and must complete every condition of supervision
Shall write letter of apology to mother through agent
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

14CF206 & 14CM261 - Defendant Thomas D. Kroken in court with attorney Randall E. Doyle.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; Def stands mute; Court enters not guilty plea; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Attorney Doyle request modification of bond;  request the no contact order be lifted so the parties can arrange for placement with the minor children.  State objects.  Court sets matter for motion hearing;  Atty Doyle advised to filie a written motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 04:15 pm.

same prior conditions;   Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $40.00 by next court date.

Doyle heard on Def.'s FTA at PH - mixup on date, possible waiver; Def. turned self in yesterday; State heard on bond; address verified; Court orders prior $1,000.00 PA Bond reinstated w/same conditions, WF $40 by next court date; PH reset to 9/25/14 at 3:00pm in Br. 2

(8:43 a.m.)  14CF206 & 14CM261 - Defendant, Thomas D. Kroken in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. is not eligible for public defender.  Def S/T, court questions def regarding request for court appointed attorney.  Court grants request and appoints Atty Randy Doyle, def to pay $50/month comm. 8/15/14.

Defendant, Thomas D. Kroken in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim MJG and her residence.    Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.
